components.description:
A light-green variety of a common pear, shown with a stem and sometimes green leaf.

May be used for its namesake expression, pear-shaped (“prominent hips” or “failure”).

In 2023 this emoji was coopted by the company Pear and its customers to note within their social media profiles that they are not in a relationship and are open to meeting a new romantic partner.
components.title: Pear

description:
A light-green variety of a common pear, shown with a stem and sometimes green leaf.

May be used for its namesake expression, pear-shaped (“prominent hips” or “failure”).

In 2023 this emoji was coopted by the company Pear and its customers to note within their social media profiles that they are not in a relationship and are open to meeting a new romantic partner.
title: Pear

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Fruit and vegetable symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A light green-colored fruit, which defines a¬†pear-shape. Pear was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Co http://emojipedia.org/pear/
emoji_net_data.name: pear

bn:00100064a: That can be eaten without harm; innocuous to humans; suitable for consumption.
That can be eaten without harm, non-toxic to humans; suitable for consumption.

bn:00100914a: Of the color between blue and yellow in the color spectrum; similar to the color of fresh grass

Having green as its colour; having the hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers.

bn:00106506a: Fully developed or matured and ready to be eaten or used
Fully developed; grown up in terms of physical appearance, behaviour or thinking; ripe.
Maturated or suppurated; ready to discharge; -- said of sores, tumors, etc.
Maturated or suppurated, of sores and tumors.

bn:00087460v: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.

bn:00061188n: The European pear Pyrus communis, also known as common pear, is a species of pear native to central and eastern Europe and southwest Asia.
A tree of the genus Pyrus, which bears the pears as fruits.
(also pear tree) A type of fruit tree (Pyrus communis).
A tree of the genus Pyrus.
The pear is any of several tree and shrub species of genus Pyrus, in the family Rosaceae.
A tree producing the pear fruit.
Old World tree having sweet gritty-textured juicy fruit; widely cultivated in many varieties

bn:00036686n: The ripened reproductive body of a seed plant
Fruit, in broad terms, is a structure of a plant that contains its seeds.
The seed-bearing part of a plant, often edible, colourful/colorful and fragrant, produced from a floral ovary after fertilization.
A fully matured plant ovary with or without other floral or shoot parts united with it at maturity.
In botany, a fruit is a part of a flowering plant that derives from specific tissues of the flower, one or more ovaries, and in some cases accessory tissues.

bn:00035650n: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the pear emoji presents a delightful, ripe fruit rendered with Apple's characteristic smooth gradients and soft rounded edges. Its pearlescent sheen and subtle highlights suggest a juicy, sweet treat, embodying a sense of natural goodness and simple pleasure. This emoji, with its gentle curves and inviting color, is often used to represent healthy eating, sweetness, or a general appreciation for nature's bounty.
